info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 22 at 8:04PM CDT until April 22 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Irion.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Some river or stream flows may still be elevated from heavy rainfall this past weekend.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 PM CDT, National Weather Service radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain repeatedly developing and tracking over central and southern parts of Irion County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen, and an additional half to one inch of rain is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mertzon, Sherwood, Barnhart and Arden. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Ranch Road 853 crossing Middle Concho River, Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, County Road 202 crossing Spring Creek, County Road 113 crossing Dove Creek, crossings along County Road 302, crossings along County Road 411, County Road 202 crossing Lopez Creek and Sherwood Cemetery crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING
